Description of measure implemented: On 10 March 2020 government announced that all universities will close their classes at the latest by 16 March.

102 German citizens and 26 relatives, all of whom were symptom-free on departure, were evacuated from the Wuhan region to Frankfurt am Main by the Executive Transport Wing of the German Air Force. After their return, they were placed in quarantine in a military barrack in Rhineland-Palatinate for 14 days.[716] The coronavirus was found in two passengers on 2 February.
Keywords: international traveller screening, traveller quarantine, traveller testing

Description of measure implemented: All schools, nurseries and colleges closed.
Keywords: nursery schools closure, school closure, university closure

Description of measure implemented: If one person in any household has a persistent cough or fever, everyone living there must stay at home for 14 days
By the weekend, those with the most serious health conditions must be "largely shielded from social contact for around 12 weeks"
Everyone should avoid gatherings with friends and family, as well as large gatherings and crowded places, such as pubs, clubs and theatres
People who are self-isolating with mild symptoms are no longer being tested for the virus.
Keywords: end of testing, testing criteria tightened

Description of measure implemented: Britons returning from northern Italy told to self-isolate
Keywords: international traveller screening, travel warning, traveller quarantine

Description of measure implemented: The Foreign & Commonwealth Office (FCO) advises British people against all but essential travel worldwide due to unprecedented international border closures and other restrictions.
